articles.title: Satellite Constellations Are Ruining Hubble Images - Gizmodo
articles.description: New research shows the alarming degree to which Hubble images are being ruined by satellites passing through the telescope’s field of view.
articles.content:
The steadily growing satellite population has been posing challenges for ground-based astronomy, but new research reveals that space-based telescopes like Hubble are also suffering.

articles.title: Hubble Peers at a Galactic Seascape - NASA
articles.description: A “jellyfish galaxy” with trailing tentacles of stars hangs in inky blackness in this image from the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope.
